intro: Cypholophus prostratus, commonly known as the prostrate cypholophus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
